Home
•
About
•
About PVCH
Ponte Vedra Concert Hall
ABOUT
Ponte Vedra Concert Hall hosts over 140 concerts and events each year and is recognized as a must-play venue among artists. The venue is versatile in programming and setting with the ability to transform from a 615-seated theatre to a 1103-person standing room only concert hall, welcoming rock & roll legends one night and stand-up comedy the next.
Ponte Vedra Concert Hall is managed and operated by SJC Cultural Events, Inc. (SJCCE), a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization committed to enriching St. Johns County and engaging music enthusiasts worldwide through authentic cultural programming. Guided by the principle of being “Community Owned, Community Operated, Community Led,” SJCCE passionately promotes performances by internationally acclaimed artists and hosts educational and community-tailored events aimed at fostering a deeper appreciation for the arts. At the forefront of St. Johns County's vibrant live music scene, SJCCE manages and operates The St. Augustine Amphitheatre and Ponte Vedra Concert Hall. Additionally, the organization produces the acclaimed Sing Out Loud Festival and Fort Mose Jazz & Blues Series, contributing significantly to both the cultural enrichment and economic vitality of the St. Johns County community.
HISTORY
Ponte Vedra Concert Hall was built with a modern, historical twist. Constructed from the foundation of an old Baptist church in 2011, the renovation and repurpose of the sacred space led to the creation of a flexible entertainment venue. In its 13-year history, Ponte Vedra Concert Hall has featured over 480 unique artists, many of which return year after year. Over 1,100 shows have taken place on our stage, and nearly 400,000 people have walked through our doors. We are thrilled to begin a new era in 2025, and homage to the past events that brought us to where we are today, at the precipice of a new era.
1980 - Structure is Built
Palm Valley Baptist Church purchases property and builds a 17,330 sq. ft. auditorium at 1050 A1A North, Ponte Vedra Beach, FL.
2002 - New Beginnings Baptist Church Becomes Owner
The building changes owners to New Beginnings Baptist Church.
2006 - St. Johns County Purchases Property
St. Johns County purchases the property from New Beginnings Baptist Church for $9.2M.
2009 - Renovations
Renovations begin to transform the former church into Ponte Vedra Concert Hall.
Ponte Vedra turning former church property into concert hall (jacksonville.com)
2011 - Ponte Vedra Concert Hall Opens
Opening Month at Ponte Vedra Concert Hall:
2/13 – Great Big Sea
2/17 – Leon Redbone
2/20 – The B-52’s
2/24 – Travis Tritt
2/25 – Arturo Sandoval
2018 - Outdoor Terrace Added
The Friends of the Ponte Vedra Concert Hall donate $50K to build the 925 sq. ft. outdoor terrace.
2020 - Lighting Upgrade & Elevate Campaign Launches
The Friends of the Ponte Vedra Concert launch the “Elevate Campaign” – an ambitious project to renovate the Concert Hall.
2022 - St. Johns County Approves Renovation Project
St. Johns County approves $5.4M for PVCH renovation in a 5-0 vote, providing the financial foundation for the balcony project. Additional funding is secured to complete a comprehensive renovation of the 40-year-old structure.
2024 - Renovations Commence
Renovations begin at Ponte Vedra Concert Hall. Follow the progress
HERE
.
2025 - A New Era Begins
The fully renovated, reimagined Ponte Vedra Concert Hall reopens, and the New Era begins!
